positive.review: This game cured my stage four pancreatic cancer and made my family not homeless

Tight combat, smooth controls, gorgeous pixel art.... and a crushing sense of deja vu every few minutes.

So like Hades, but with less talking and more dying. Highly recommended.

Dead Cells taught me an important lesson: no matter how many fancy weapons I find, I will absolutely still roll directly into danger like a caffeinated tumbleweed.

The game is basically:
- Die.
- Come back.
- Pretend you learned something.
- Die again but with style.

Combat feels amazing, exploration is addictive, and the soundtrack makes me feel like I should be parkouring off my own walls. If you‚Äôve ever wanted to experience the joy of failure at 200 miles per hour, this is your game.

10/10, my cells have never been more dead.

dead cells more like rage cells fuck this game bro either im shit or the game hates me
anyways get it its awesome 10/10 would recommend

One of my favorite games evrrr. I've put in a lot more hours on playstation & switch if it doesn't seem like my time on the game matches the statement. If you like Castlevania you will likely enjoy Dead Cells. The variety of weapons will keep interest as well as add different strategies. The maps change each playthrough although the core themes are constant. It's a pick up and play game. You can come back to it without missing a beat ü•Åüí•

Have a great day & hopefully a great play!
still can‚Äôt beat the game on all stem cells. For those who haven‚Äôt yet tried this roguelike game, I highly recommend giving it a go. 8 out of 10

If you like Ori or Hollow Knight, and you also love roguelikes then this is the game for you. The progression is really consistent so dying doesn‚Äôt feel too frustrating. You‚Äôre always learning new biomes, enemies, and bosses. Over time you unlock new weapons, movement abilities, and upgrades. This is a great Steam Deck game.

i don‚Äôt have that many hours of this game but i really love it. i always play it when i feel boring about other games like‚Ä¶ this game never gets me bored, i always love to kill these monsters and get many kind of weapons. really got me excited so i really recommend it

I came to Dead Cells as a long-time fan of metroidvanias, and it did not disappoint. Usually, I'm not a fan of heavy metaprogression mechanics, but the core gameplay here is so engaging that it did not matter to me.

This is hands-down the "flowiest" action roguelite. The movement is precise, and the combat is responsive and dynamic. Even more, there is variety in regions, enemies, items, and secrets to find. This makes it my favorite Action roguelite (so far).
cara vale cada sentavo eu jogo isso com uma mao no controle e outra em baixo pq esse jogo eh o puro tesao eu ja zerei ele pelo xbox e to zerando pelo pc e vale cada segundo

Incredible game. Beautiful art, hype soundtrack, and flawless gameplay. SO satisfying when a run comes together. 50 hours in and barely scratched the surface. My backlog is going to have to wait. 
Don't bother waiting for a sale, this is must play.

This is a very fun and challenging game with loads upon loads of content, in its base form there is so much to do and you can expand on that with DLCs. Its a very fun game to play and you should try it out now!

I don't know what it is about this game, but it has quickly become one of my absolute favorites!! Its so easy to just get absorbed in the gameplay! <33 I could (and have) play this game for hours hehehe

Had this game since 2018 used to play it on offline mode that's why it doesn't say the accurate hours.

Every time I revisit the game there's more and more content, the love given to this game by the Motion Twin and the community is amazing and that's what's keeping this game one of the best games I've played ever.
Amazing game. the visuals match the vibe and feeling of the game. the difficulty is just spot on, and there are so many secrets, that it will be hard to put down even after finishing the final boss.

Personally, this can be my favorite game and at times, least favorite game that makes me wanna throw my steam deck against the wall

Still heavily recommended. :PEAKbingbong:
is fun game. could use a better modding scene. like the divercity of combat and the rewards for exploration

10/10 would sacrifice mushroom boi again

Great basic game + free DLC, and the other DLCs are absolutely worth it as well

Dead Cells ‚Äî Fast-Paced Roguelike Action at Its Finest

Dead Cells is a masterclass in tight, fluid combat and procedural design. From the very first run, the game hooks you with its fast-paced movement, responsive controls, and endless surprises around every corner. Every level feels alive, challenging, and meticulously crafted, keeping you on your toes while rewarding skill and experimentation.

Combat is both satisfying and strategic. Whether you‚Äôre slashing with swords, raining arrows from a distance, or experimenting with magical abilities, every encounter demands quick thinking and adaptability. The variety of weapons, abilities, and power-ups ensures no two runs feel the same, making every death feel like a learning experience rather than a setback.

The procedural levels are beautifully designed, blending consistency with unpredictability. You‚Äôll explore sprawling castles, perilous biomes, and hidden areas, all teeming with enemies, secrets, and loot. Each run is a fresh challenge, keeping the game endlessly replayable.

Progression is rewarding and fair. Unlocking new weapons, mutations, and abilities encourages experimentation and creates a sense of growth across multiple runs. The game strikes a perfect balance between challenge and satisfaction, making every victory feel earned.

Visually, Dead Cells is stunning. Pixel art meets fluid animation in a style that‚Äôs both retro and modern. Coupled with an energetic soundtrack, the game‚Äôs atmosphere feels tense, vibrant, and utterly alive.

[h3]Final Verdict:[/h3]
Dead Cells is a thrilling roguelike that combines fluid combat, clever design, and endless replayability. Challenging, rewarding, and endlessly fun, it‚Äôs a must-play for anyone who loves action-packed platformers and roguelikes.

‚ÄúFast, fluid, and endlessly rewarding ‚Äî Dead Cells proves that roguelikes can be both challenging and exhilarating.‚Äù

Overall Rating: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê 10/10
Absolutely amazing, the game has comfortable keybinds, it's got gorgeous graphics and the game is challenging but not too difficult. 8.5/10
perfect gameplay and run well on low end devices. Played it first on game pass and love it, so i bought it on steam for my steam deck oled.

King's Staff has [b]it's[/b] instead of [b]its[/b] in the item description, literally unplayable

(in all seriousness though, this is a fun game, force-enabling [spoiler]the Malaise[/spoiler] on lower difficulties using Custom Mode makes the game so much better, especially since it doesn't disable achievements)
great combat feel , good pixel graphics and is fun getting across the levels

I had the strange experience of buying this game on a whim and 5 minutes later seeing the anime on TV. I have to say great job on both of them.  The play loop is very satisfying and the further i get the more interesting the enemies get. Now, I'm  not saying its an easy game, but its worth the time you'll put into it.

nice visuals, good music, fine story and extremely good gameplay with good areas and enemies.
9.5/10
Es entretenido. Aunque al principio cueste empezar de cero cada vez que mueres, te das cuenta de que no est√° tan mal, ya que te da la oportunidad de mejorar y probar cosas nuevas.
Once you get going, its a non-stop intense action packed platformer with an incredible skill ceiling. Very satisfying to conquer, and its DLC have been incredible so far, especially for the price.

It become satisfying after several runs when you start feel the game mechanics and start understand how it works. Well fast-paced, but doesn't punish you too much for playing slow. I would say your gameplay actually accelerates at some point.
Don't consider heavy plot here.
DLCs are nice, you can take them very cheap on sales
I compare every rogue-like to this game. Stellar combat, great music. 10/10 would become an algae blob again

Very fun once you get the hang of the controls and gameplay loop. Overall a difficult experience. It is also very much a rougelite, in the sense that you definitely need the upgrades to improve and get better between runs. Your starting runs will probably be very hard and very short, but don't let that turn you away from what the game eventually has to offer as you get more powerful.

Slick controls, & addicting gameplay.
It's a shame the controller vibration is broken, and the resolution isn't scalable
Dead cells? More like I keep on dying but the gameplay is fun and the bosses are good and its also got a ton of weapons to try and its very rewarding to beat cells.

fun game with nice lore the character design is really nice and the soundtrack is amazing. This is one of the best games I ever played on iPad (a controller is a must), though would love to see them add cloud saves so I can get back to where I was on all devices.
Good game, so many weapons, outfits, and secrets also fun bosses/gameplay loop

Fun rogue like game, you figure out the weapons you like to play as use play more. Easy to run as well, runs easy on my Macbook Air M4. The plot is in segments through environmental design and short text sequences. Action is very fun, will recommend. The
One of the better roguelites out there, fun fast paced combat.

If I had just one complaint with Dead Cells...it's that everytime I've tried to play this offline, I lose all of my progress in a level, and have to start over. I get that it's a rogue game where you're encouraged to start over, but anytime I want to play this on my Steam Deck, it gets maddening, because this means anytime I want to play Dead Cells, I have to commit and beat a run without taking a break.
Otherwise, I'm repeatedly starting over EVERY. SINGLE. TIME.

But other than that, I've really enjoyed this game, and look forward to seeing everything this game has to offer. I'd still recommend it.

Feels like playing one of the originals from NES with dope graphics and godly mechanics, and so fluid too....the fact that its ever changing makes it perfect for someone who grew up beating the same game over and over without dying after learning everything's timing....its like having a new game over and over here lol, i feel dumb for not trying this out years ago, but will surely be buying every DLC. grateful they added so much even though im just scratching the surface
Great game, highly replayable DLC is worth buying,

I bought this game on a whim. I have never  regretted this purchase. I played a little bit off and on for a long time. I got a Steamdeck. I boot it up clearly clear a backlog and boot this up for a run or 2. The backlog doesn't get cleared. I end up playing for hours. The game is hard enough to infurate you(after you beat it a couple times) but also satisfying when you get the weapon skill combos to make a deep run. Dracula adds a new end boss to the mix.
Good Game and skills development and difficulty is top notch. Levels 1 to 5+
It's worth the money but the gameplay loop gets real boring without the dlcs
Love this game, I finished the game with 1 set of equipment, using another set make me feel like playing this game all over again ( the difficulty, of course ) =))
The speed boost mechanic is really great and feels very satisfying when you actually get a weapon that clicks with you and you breeze through a level. Great game
I would say that it's one of the best, but masochisty games that I've played I recommend it to everyone who has enough time and nerves.
With appeals to both the old and new school, this is an excellent game that should not be overlooked, regardless of age.

It's obviously doing something special. 

I got it on discount, and enjoyed my few hours with it, but because of the genre that's about all I'll devout to it. Still, I can respect and recognize it is an incredible game for someone more into this genre.

This is the gold standard to which all other roguelikes should be held to. If you like action platformers or roguelikes at all then it's a must-buy.

The only thing I can knock Dead Cells for is that some aspects of the game's design and its story feel unfinished.  Motion Twin pulled the plug on the game and stopped the developers (Evil Empire) from completing their roadmap of additional DLCs and updates into 2026, as they decided it would be a competitor to its newer title, Windblown. I will never buy Windblown for this reason and highly recommend you both buy this game and support Evil Empire in their new projects instead.
dead cells is fast addictive and super fun the combat and movement feel great and even though it can get frustrating sometimes its still so good and i cant stop playing it
the combat in this game is very smooth and fun and the roguelike aspects are perfect, but fuck Motion Twin
Endless replayability and lots of dlc. defintely my most played on my steam deck.

Remember:  this game is super cheap as far as magical expanding hit-boxes, enemies that get basically get pooped out strategically though "it's random" and proceed to warp through a few walls to get that auspicious first hit on you after you decided to roll the dice on a cursed object.  Totally random, that.  Yeah DC is as cheap as it gets -- they pinch their nipples fo sho when you get frustrated..  But don't burn your PC, ok?  Just find an old CD burner and make copies of the game to toss in the microwave.  CD ART!  Better than another 30 seconds with the Rampager.
If you don't get it you'll regret it, top 3 indie games ever made, haven't even gotten full experience in almost 75 hours, so much content to enjoy

Hundred of hours of content, great replayability, beautiful art, interesting lore, runs in almost every single device and it's only 2 god damn GB. Do I need to say anything else? Recommended, worth every penny.
I played so much of this damn game while sucking more than a [Insert Dirty Joke Here], and still enjoyed it thoroughly. Good job Motion Twin!

I absolutely love this game. A lot of things to do here and a lot of time to spend

This is an oddly addicting game, initially when you start the game is little weird to get the hang if but a few hours in it just clicks, you start moving fluidly, you can parry enemy attacks and use your weapons as they, no matter what you have, you just get the hang of it at one point, and once you reach that state, this game feel amazing, i am just 20 hours in and am loving it, still haven't beaten it tho.

This became obsessive... gameplay is so addicting and as soon as you die, you just want to restart and play again.

Honestly, I think this is the best rogue-like replayable platform action game of all time, and I don't think its even close. The difficulty is high, but it needs to be, and every thing about this game is fun and satisfying, the items, builds, the levels, the boss fights, the unlockables, the lore and humor is spot on. I can't imagine a better type of game in this genre, quite possibly the perfect game for what it is trying to be. If you like this genre and you haven't played Dead Cells, then stop what you are doing and play it... right now...

Simply the best rogue-like ever made.

DLCs might seems expensive, but it triples the game's life span.

I have already 25 hours into the game and I'm sooooo far from the 100%. This game is so massive that it never feels repetitive at any point if you quit your comfort zone and try new builds and biomes.
Yeah, it's pretty fun with a variety of steam workshop mods for picking what kind of game you want to play.
A phenomenal game with a fun experience every time. Challenging, but enjoyable.
This game is very engaging where we face each gradual/sequential level, and each level also has its own difficulty level with various different monsters.

negative.review:
Amazing potential cut short by a greedy dev civil war. DO. NOT. SUPPORT. MOTION. TWIN.

SUPPORT EVIL EMPIRE, THEY ARE THE TRUE DEVS OF THIS GAME!!!

Game used to be 10/10
Game now crashes using intergration.
First it just didn't work right, now it just straight crashes the game.
0/10

The game is fun but the ads for the DLC  are insanely annoying. I found a secret area and was super excited to go there, but I got hit with a paywall saying I needed the DLC to continue further. Absurd!!

Its just not as fun as other Rogue-like games that I've played.
Yes I am aware that it is a skill issue and that I'm bad at the game. 
I was hoping that I would be able to put as many hours into the game as "Hades" and it would be just as rewarding. 

But as it is not rewarding or fun, effectively I've wasted my money.

Bought this game for dirt cheap many years ago and finally got around to playing it (it became part of that dreaded "backlog" we all have). 

It is a Rogue game. If you are someone that likes making progress in your games, values a story or actually progressing while playing, look the other way. This genre is terrible if any of the above things matter to you at all.

If however, you enjoy playing the same section of a game over and over again with no save points, no checkpoints, and the smallest mistake forces you to lose everything and do it all over again, this is a game for you!

I was interested in the art style and thought it played like classic side scrollers from "back in the day" but that is not the case. Apparently this genre is absurdly popular but having finally gotten around to actually trying this game, I don't understand the appeal. Roguelike and Roguelite are being added to my Steam tag exclusion list. 

This just isn't for me. Hopefully this review helps you make an informed decision but I guess I'm in the minority, it's overwhelmingly positive for some reason. Try it for a couple hours and if you're like me and hate it, refund it.

Game sucks!!! You cant use weapons. Normal mode is like Nightmare mode.
Impossible.

retarded game

Extremely good game, with amazing level design, how you can approach each level, and with very fun asserty of weapons and magic you can use. 
Sadly, the upper devs of Motion Twin decided to get rid of the original Dead cells team, and canned the next 2 years of collabs and updates/dlcs to promote their new IP. The greed always wins.
Cant recommend it, as the money doesnt go to the people that actually made the game, but to the money-grubbing dicks at the top of Motion Twin. 
Get the game by other means, if you know what i mean.

Game itself is good, but the publishers got rid of the team working on Dead Cells in favor of promoting their new IP. Left a real sour taste in my mouth, so wouldn't recommend buying it since the profits no longer go to the people who actually made this game what it is

Game is fun but small bugs and glitches ruin it.  

 - Ledge grabbing is hit or miss, creating annoying scenarios where you need to time movements or you will either repeatedly grab an ledge or keep missing

  

 - Drop down through floors needs changed to different buttons as the keys to drop (hold down + jump button) don't work well, together.  I will hold down and try to drop through the floor but instead I jump.  I try again and jump.  It takes a second to recognize the input but in a game where a split second can decide if you live or die should not rely on whether the game can read the input fast enough.  Not too mention levels with spikes just above your head and the game doesn't read you're holding down will make you jump into spikes.

- if too many enemy's are being hit by your attacks, a few may be ignored and freely attack you

- Weapon drop RNG needs refreshed as I'm getting drops for weapons I never use or don't work for upcoming levels.  Some effects rely on the environment but when only one level meets that criteria for the weapon, there's no point in using it.  Some are too slow to use and will never get any use.  Shields are completely useless and should be removed from the game.

Amazing potential cut short by a greedy dev civil war. DO. NOT. SUPPORT. MOTION. TWIN.

SUPPORT EVIL EMPIRE, THEY ARE THE TRUE DEVS OF THIS GAME!!!

i don't like this. the lack of mechanics just feels so lackluster to me, like you're doing the same thing in the entire run, while in other games you can feel some sort of "progress" and "leveling up" this just feels like no progress at all.
to me it just feels like going right and doing the same slashing over and over again til you win

The game is fun but the ads for the DLC  are insanely annoying. I found a secret area and was super excited to go there, but I got hit with a paywall saying I needed the DLC to continue further. Absurd!!
Wanted to like this, it starts fun but devolves into tedious cell grind around bad progression system where you have to choose between cool unlocks and your characters getting stronger

Bought this game for dirt cheap many years ago and finally got around to playing it (it became part of that dreaded "backlog" we all have). 

It is a Rogue game. If you are someone that likes making progress in your games, values a story or actually progressing while playing, look the other way. This genre is terrible if any of the above things matter to you at all.

If however, you enjoy playing the same section of a game over and over again with no save points, no checkpoints, and the smallest mistake forces you to lose everything and do it all over again, this is a game for you!

I was interested in the art style and thought it played like classic side scrollers from "back in the day" but that is not the case. Apparently this genre is absurdly popular but having finally gotten around to actually trying this game, I don't understand the appeal. Roguelike and Roguelite are being added to my Steam tag exclusion list. 

This just isn't for me. Hopefully this review helps you make an informed decision but I guess I'm in the minority, it's overwhelmingly positive for some reason. Try it for a couple hours and if you're like me and hate it, refund it.

The game is fun but the ads for the DLC  are insanely annoying. I found a secret area and was super excited to go there, but I got hit with a paywall saying I needed the DLC to continue further. Absurd!!

Played around 10 hours on switch. 

In my opinion this is insanely overhyped game. I regret buying it.

Truth is, it very repetitive, super grindy and kinda boring.

HEAVY RNG DEPENDENT.
Maybe if you like casino style games you will like it.

Sometimes runs is 1 button kill due to insane RNG, but most of the time it is easier to die right after the start. 
(this game really just needs "restart run" in options)

Especially on harder difficulties then you get boss cells. Levels 4+ have swarms of mobs that kills you instantly and game does not provide you with tools to do so. Lots of cheap deaths than something(s) fire at you simultaneously from outside the screen viewport.

From the looks of it, this is in no way a melee game. Controls is not that responsive, sometimes you stuck in animation (and can't parry), sometimes don't. If you face 2+ enemies from each side there is nothing except roll (because parry only works the direction you are facing). From 7 (!) years of updates I hoped gameplay will be more polished. Also I watched some of the speedruns and even pro players get constantly damaged by mobs.

So only way out is some kind of ranged dps \ dot builds. But it is RNG game so maybe 1 out of 5 runs have somewhat decent drops.

Last thing is at this point of the game I don't see any upgrades that will help progression. It is not like you going to more powerful weapons, just more variety of them. And most of them sucks or joke weapons from collaborations with other popular titles.

So yeah, not recommended.

Bought this game for dirt cheap many years ago and finally got around to playing it (it became part of that dreaded "backlog" we all have). 

It is a Rogue game. If you are someone that likes making progress in your games, values a story or actually progressing while playing, look the other way. This genre is terrible if any of the above things matter to you at all.

If however, you enjoy playing the same section of a game over and over again with no save points, no checkpoints, and the smallest mistake forces you to lose everything and do it all over again, this is a game for you!

I was interested in the art style and thought it played like classic side scrollers from "back in the day" but that is not the case. Apparently this genre is absurdly popular but having finally gotten around to actually trying this game, I don't understand the appeal. Roguelike and Roguelite are being added to my Steam tag exclusion list. 

This just isn't for me. Hopefully this review helps you make an informed decision but I guess I'm in the minority, it's overwhelmingly positive for some reason. Try it for a couple hours and if you're like me and hate it, refund it.

Its just not as fun as other Rogue-like games that I've played.
Yes I am aware that it is a skill issue and that I'm bad at the game. 
I was hoping that I would be able to put as many hours into the game as "Hades" and it would be just as rewarding. 

But as it is not rewarding or fun, effectively I've wasted my money.

Some effects rely on the environment but when only one level meets that criteria for the weapon, there's no point in using it.  Some are too slow to use and will never get any use.  Shields are completely useless and should be removed from the game.

Amazing potential cut short by a greedy dev civil war. DO. NOT. SUPPORT. MOTION. TWIN.

SUPPORT EVIL EMPIRE, THEY ARE THE TRUE DEVS OF THIS GAME!!!

i don't like this. the lack of mechanics just feels so lackluster to me, like you're doing the same thing in the entire run, while in other games you can feel some sort of "progress" and "leveling up" this just feels like no progress at all.
to me it just feels like going right and doing the same slashing over and over again til you win
it was kind of fun but on my 4k screen which I have had for years the teleports did not work at all, this is a basic bug old a 6 year old game. i got a steam refund.

Game used to be 10/10
Game now crashes using intergration.
First it just didn't work right, now it just straight crashes the game.
0/10

The game is fun but the ads for the DLC  are insanely annoying. I found a secret area and was super excited to go there, but I got hit with a paywall saying I needed the DLC to continue further. Absurd!!

Played around 10 hours on switch. 

In my opinion this is insanely overhyped game. I regret buying it.

Truth is, it very repetitive, super grindy and kinda boring.

HEAVY RNG DEPENDENT.
Maybe if you like casino style games you will like it.

Sometimes runs is 1 button kill due to insane RNG, but most of the time it is easier to die right after the start. 
(this game really just needs "restart run" in options)

Especially on harder difficulties then you get boss cells. Levels 4+ have swarms of mobs that kills you instantly and game does not provide you with tools to do so. Lots of cheap deaths than something(s) fire at you simultaneously from outside the screen viewport.

From the looks of it, this is in no way a melee game. Controls is not that responsive, sometimes you stuck in animation (and can't parry), sometimes don't. If you face 2+ enemies from each side there is nothing except roll (because parry only works the direction you are facing). From 7 (!) years of updates I hoped gameplay will be more polished. Also I watched some of the speedruns and even pro players get constantly damaged by mobs.

So only way out is some kind of ranged dps \ dot builds. But it is RNG game so maybe 1 out of 5 runs have somewhat decent drops.

Last thing is at this point of the game I don't see any upgrades that will help progression. It is not like you going to more powerful weapons, just more variety of them. And most of them sucks or joke weapons from collaborations with other popular titles.

So yeah, not recommended.

Bought this game for dirt cheap many years ago and finally got around to playing it (it became part of that dreaded "backlog" we all have). 

It is a Rogue game. If you are someone that likes making progress in your games, values a story or actually progressing while playing, look the other way. This genre is terrible if any of the above things matter to you at all.

If however, you enjoy playing the same section of a game over and over again with no save points, no checkpoints, and the smallest mistake forces you to lose everything and do it all over again, this is a game for you!

I was interested in the art style and thought it played like classic side scrollers from "back in the day" but that is not the case. Apparently this genre is absurdly popular but having finally gotten around to actually trying this game, I don't understand the appeal. Roguelike and Roguelite are being added to my Steam tag exclusion list. 

This just isn't for me. Hopefully this review helps you make an informed decision but I guess I'm in the minority, it's overwhelmingly positive for some reason. Try it for a couple hours and if you're like me and hate it, refund it.

Its just not as fun as other Rogue-like games that I've played.
Yes I am aware that it is a skill issue and that I'm bad at the game. 
I was hoping that I would be able to put as many hours into the game as "Hades" and it would be just as rewarding. 

But as it is not rewarding or fun, effectively I've wasted my money.
Dead cells was my nickname in high school because i always had on crusty socks. this games okay though, i guess. or not idrk.

Game sucks!!! You cant use weapons. Normal mode is like Nightmare mode.
Impossible.
If you run Linux this game does not support controllers. Trash
Yeah... fuck this game and all the games like it.
Not sure what all the hype is about this game.
Where the fuck is the 5th boss cell
retarded game

Game is fun but small bugs and glitches ruin it.  

 - Ledge grabbing is hit or miss, creating annoying scenarios where you need to time movements or you will either repeatedly grab an ledge or keep missing

  

 - Drop down through floors needs changed to different buttons as the keys to drop (hold down + jump button) don't work well, together.  I will hold down and try to drop through the floor but instead I jump.  I try again and jump.  It takes a second to recognize the input but in a game where a split second can decide if you live or die should not rely on whether the game can read the input fast enough.  Not too mention levels with spikes just above your head and the game doesn't read you're holding down will make you jump into spikes.

- if too many enemy's are being hit by your attacks, a few may be ignored and freely attack you

- Weapon drop RNG needs refreshed as I'm getting drops for weapons I never use or don't work for upcoming levels.  Some effects rely on the environment but when only one level meets that criteria for the weapon, there's no point in using it.  Some are too slow to use and will never get any use.  Shields are completely useless and should be removed from the game.

Amazing potential cut short by a greedy dev civil war. DO. NOT. SUPPORT. MOTION. TWIN.

SUPPORT EVIL EMPIRE, THEY ARE THE TRUE DEVS OF THIS GAME!!!
